titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: The Hutchinson House/Chapelwood Auxiliary was organized to support the work of a nursing and rehabilitation institution in Devon, Pennsylvania, run by Presbyterian Homes, Inc. In the mid-1980s, the institution was known as the Eliza Cathcart Home. Around 1987, the name was changed to Cathcart Health Center. In 1999, the auxiliary changed its name to Hutchinson House/Chapelwood Auxiliary to reflect its work on behalf of the larger organization of which Cathcart had been a part. The auxiliary held its last meeting in April 2002.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of the Hutchinson House/Chapelwood Auxiliary. The collection dates from 1985 to 2002, and includes meeting agendas, minutes, and correspondence; newsletters; membership lists; the Auxiliary's constitution and by-laws; newspaper clippings about the Cathcart Home; flyers and invitations for events; materials documenting the 100th anniversary of the Cathcart Home in 1992; and photographs from a 2001 bazaar.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
